lexUnit.name: refusal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of indicating unwillingness to accept or grant (something offered or requested).

sentence.text: His idea found a ready audience among those , not least the Republicans , who were angered by the constant refusal of the Royal government to contemplate even an extension of the very limited franchise which prevailed .
Combined Concerns had appealed against Scarborough Council 's refusal of permission for the scheme at Bog Hall .

The Law Society announced today that it would appeal to the Court of Appeal against the Divisional Court 's refusal of its application for a declaration that the Lord Chancellor 's proposed standard fee scheme was unlawful .

On Dec. 11 the Supreme Court refused to review the unanimous refusal on Sept. 8 by the Court of Appeals to reconsider the earlier decision .

If there was a single reason , thought Henry , why he was once again determined to poison her , it was probably her stubborn refusal to go along with his earlier attempt .
His refusal to deal with the PLO is practical , not emotional .
Editors sometimes justify their refusal to publish letters by victims of attacks in their newspapers , on the grounds that they contain passages libellous of their journalists .

The British Prime Minister , John Major , has spoken out against the US 's refusal to commit itself to a declaration concerning targets and schedules aimed at controlling emissions of greenhouse gasses .

The relative failure of cricket as a popular spectacle lay ` in the deliberate refusal of its administrators to modernize .
